Disebut Akan Maju Pilkada Pandeglang, Apa Kata Susi Pudjiastuti?
05 Nov 2019, 02:01 by Caesar Akbar, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Bekas Menteri Kelautan dan Perikanan Susi Pudjiastuti membantah isu bahwa dirinya akan maju dalam Pemilihan Kepala Daerah Pandeglang. Ia mengatakan kabar tersebut tidak benar.
"Hoax," cuit Susi melalui akun twitter resminya @susipudjiastuti, Ahad, 3 November 2019. Cuitan itu dilontarkan membalas sebuah berita yang ditautkan akun @idtodaydotco, yang berjudul 'Warga Bosan Dinasti, Susi Pudjiastuti Disebut Maju Pilkada di Pandeglang?'
Cuitan Susi Pudjiastuti pun disukai oleh 40 warganet dan dicuit ulang sebanyak 13 kali. Berbagai komentar pun melayang menanggapi cuitan Susi. Salah satu di antaranya berasal dari @hidayatropik86 yang menyarankan Susi memperkarakan berita tersebut. "Kalau hoaks tuntut Bu!" cuit dia.
Komentar lainnya berbunyi jargon khas Susi, 'Tenggelamkan'. Cuitan itu antara lain dilontarkan @sahlan30842941, "tenggelamkan saja Bu," tulisnya. Maupun, cuitan @el_mahrin850626, yang menuliskan, "tenggelamkan Bu."
Selepas masa jabatannya menjadi menteri, Susi memang belum banyak bicara soal rencananya di bidang politik. Susi Pudjiastuti justru tampak menikmati masa pensiunnya untuk berlibur. Bersama cucu pertamanya, Malika, Susi Pudjiastuti plesiran ke Jepang.
Kegiatan itu disampaikan Susi Pudjiastuti dalam pendek kepada Tempo, Senin pagi, 4 November 2019. "Hari ini (saya) di Jepang," ujar Susi dalam pesan pedeknya. Ia tak menjelaskan dengan detil aktivitas yang dilaukan di Negeri Matahari Terbit itu selain bercengkrama bersama sang cucu.
Tak lama berselang, momen plesirnya ini lantas langsung ia bagikan di media sosial Instagram dan Twitter. Susi memamerkan berbagai foto saat mengunjungi Jepang yakni Yokohama.
Ada sekitar empat foto yang ia tampilkan di media sosialnya. Dalam foto tersebut, Susi tampak mengenakan busana hitam dengan syal senada. Ia berpose di dermaga dengan latar kapal pesiar.
Sang cucu berada di depannya. Keduanya bergandengan dengan tangan sama-sama merentang. Nenek dan cucu itu sama-sama tertawa saat melihat kamera. "Yokohama, Jepang. Blue sky, blue ocean," tulis Susi Pudjiastuti diikuti ikon wajah bahagia.
CAESAR AKBAR | FRANCISCA CHRISTY

Called to Go Forward Pandeglang Election, What Said Susi Pudjiastuti?
05 Nov 2019, 02:01 by Caesar Akbar, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Former Minister of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries Susi Pudjiastuti has denied the issue that she will advance in the Regional Head Election of Pandeglang. He said the news was not true.
"Hoax," tweeted Susi through her official Twitter account @susipudjiastuti, Sunday, November 3, 2019. The tweet was sent to reply to a news story linked to the @idtodaydotco account, entitled 'Citizens of Bored Dynasty, Susi Pudjiastuti Called to Go Forward in the Pilkada in Pandeglang?'
Cuitan Susi Pudjiastuti was favored by 40 citizens and re-tweeted 13 times. Various comments also floated in response to Susi's chanting. One of them came from @ hidayatropik86, who suggested that Susi bring on the news. "If hoaks sue ma'am!" he tweeted.
Another comment reads Susi's distinctive jargon, 'Drown'. The tweet was said among others @ sahlan30842941, "Just drown Mom," he wrote. Also, cuitan @ el_mahrin850626, which says, "drown ma'am."
After his tenure as minister, Susi did not say much about his plans in the political field. Susi Pudjiastuti actually seemed to enjoy her retirement for a vacation. Together with his first grandchild, Malika, Susi Pudjiastuti traveled to Japan.
The activity was conveyed by Susi Pudjiastuti in short to Tempo, Monday morning, November 4, 2019. "Today (I) is in Japan," Susi said in her short message. He did not explain in detail the activities carried out in the Land of the Rising Sun besides chatting with his grandchildren.
Not long after, this moment of pleasure he immediately shared on social media Instagram and Twitter. Susi showed off various photos when visiting Japan, namely Yokohama.
There are about four photos that he displays on social media. In the photo, Susi appears wearing a black dress with a matching scarf. He posed on the dock with a cruise ship background.
The grandson is in front of him. Both are holding hands together stretched out. Grandma and grandchildren both laughed when they saw the camera. "Yokohama, Japan. Blue sky, blue ocean," wrote Susi Pudjiastuti followed by a happy face icon.
CAESAR AKBAR | FRANCISCA CHRISTY
